title: UCMAS or Soroban App? After Touring 3 Centers, I Made a Surprising Choice
description: UCMAS has locations everywhere. But after touring centers and comparing with online soroban apps, I went a different direction.
imageAlt: Comparing UCMAS center learning with soroban app

content.intro: When I started looking into mental math programs, UCMAS kept coming up. They have centers in most major cities. I toured three locations, talked to instructors, and compared everything to online soroban apps. My final choice surprised even me.

sections.text: UCMAS (Universal Concept of Mental Arithmetic System) is a franchise that teaches abacus-based mental math. They use the soroban method but in a classroom setting with certified instructors. Classes typically run 2-3 hours per week, plus daily homework.

items: **In-person instruction:** Teacher can correct form and technique
**Scheduling:** Fixed class times don't fit busy schedules
**Long drive:** Nearest center was 25 minutes away
**Homework battles:** More paper assignments to fight about

sections.text: Then I discovered soroban apps. Same underlying method (Japanese abacus), but:

items: **Progress tracking:** I can see stats without asking teacher

sections.text: With twins, our schedule is chaos. Between soccer practice, piano lessons, and homework, we couldn't commit to fixed class times. I also couldn't justify $200/month × 2 kids = $400/month when an app costs a fraction of that.
The deciding factor was the trial. I had both kids try a soroban app for a week. They were hooked. No battles, no nagging. They actually asked to practice. That never happened with homework.

items: Your child thrives with in-person instruction
You can commit to fixed weekly class times
You want the social aspect of group learning

sections.text: Both twins have practiced consistently with the app. They can do 2-digit addition and subtraction mentally now. Their teacher noticed improved calculation speed. And we saved roughly $1,000 compared to UCMAS.
Try the app first. If your child takes to it, you might not need the center. If they need more structure, UCMAS is always there as an option.

faq.question: Is UCMAS better quality than apps?
faq.answer: Not necessarily. Both teach the same soroban fundamentals. Apps have come a long way – adaptive learning, instant feedback, engaging interfaces. Quality depends more on consistency than delivery method.

faq.question: Will my child miss out on competitions?
faq.answer: Some soroban apps have their own leaderboards and competitions. It's not the same as in-person tournaments, but many kids find the app challenges motivating.

faq.question: Can I switch from app to UCMAS later?
faq.answer: Yes. The skills transfer. If your child outgrows the app or wants in-person learning, UCMAS can assess their level and place them appropriately.
